entry.def: If you refer to each thing or each person in a group, you are referring to every member of the group and considering them as individuals.

example.tran: 每本书都配有精美的插图。

example.ex: Each year, hundreds of animals are killed in this way...
example.tran: 每年都有数百只动物被这样杀掉。

entry.def: If you refer to each one of the members of a group, you are emphasizing that something applies to every one of them.

example.ex: He picked up forty of these publications and read each one of them.
example.tran: 他从这些出版物中挑选了40本，逐一阅读。

entry.def: You can refer to each and every member of a group to emphasize that you mean all the members of that group.

example.ex: Each and every person responsible for his murder will be brought to justice...
example.tran: 所有参与谋杀他的人都会被绳之以法。

example.ex: They can't destroy truth without destroying each and every one of us.
example.tran: 除非他们将我们赶尽杀绝，否则真理不灭。

entry.def: You use each other when you are saying that each member of a group does something to the others or has a particular connection with the others.

example.ex: We looked at each other in silence...
Both sides are willing to make allowances for each other's political sensitivities...
example.tran: 双方都愿意体谅彼此的政治敏感问题。

means.word_mean: 1. (used of count nouns) every one considered individually;
1. to or from every one of two or more (considered individually);

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English æ̅lc; related to Dutch elk and German jeglich, based on a West Germanic phrase meaning ever alike' (see aye, alike)
